conclusion: Understand the relationship between the velocity of the conductor frame, the magnetic field width, and the time for induced current.
Use the formula for the time taken for an induced current to develop in a conductor moving through a magnetic field.
Square conductor frame with side length l moves uniformly from left to right through a magnetic field with width d.
Identify the given values: side length l, width of magnetic field d, speed v, and condition l < d.
Apply the formula for the time taken for an induced current: t = l/v.
Substitute the given values into the formula: t = l/v.
Given l < d, the time t during which there is an induced current is t = l/v.
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is l/v.
